comment.author: 59529329@N03
comment._content: This appears to be a SIMLAR but NOT THE SAME IMAGE as University of Southern California Record ID: impa-m42404, [ref no] QQ-30.021.0001 in the link below as I originally thought. If you look at the the image National Archives has it is to the left of the rocks facing the same light house in the Suez Canal with the same 3 mast Bark upper left hand corner, however there is a two masted steamer behind it. The Image University of Southern California has for the Basel Mission, the photographer stood to the right of your photographer which brought the Rocks in the foreground closer to the center of his photograph. - The fact that University of Southern California's photograph has the same three masted bark you do upper left corner suggests this may have been shot the same day. The newer two masted steamer behind it is missing from their photograph but "Arnoux - lighthouse of Port Said." is to the right as well. - another difference between the two photographs is University of Southern California's photograph is writen on in cursive, while National Archives is written in print. - Although theirs does say "Arnoux 44" in print and yours says "Arnoux 15" in print. The "n" in "Arnoux" appears similar. These may be of originally of the same set of photographs. www.bmpix.org/bmpix/controller/view/impa-m42404.html "Arnoux - lighthouse of Port Said." Basel Mission in the Suez Canal. I have pasted the info from University of Southern California image in their collections. It may be worth contacting them. I have pasted info from their site for simplicity. Cheers, Bobby Ronayne ============================================================= [collection] Historical Photographs from the Basel Mission [album] "Journey to China and India." Annotation: "Arnoux 44." Title: [translation] "Arnoux - lighthouse of Port Said." Alternate Title: [original caption] "Arnoux - Phare de Port Said." Names & Dates Created: 1861/1890 Creator: [photo studio] Arnoux, Hippolyte, Port Said, Egypt Publisher: [host] University of Southern California. comment.author: 59529329@N03
comment._content: According to Kazimierz Zygadlo on Civil War forum the second ship back is Possibly the ship HMS Temeraire. Link below; history-sites.com/cgi-bin/bbs53x/cwnavy/webbbs_config.pl?... That photographer who took the pic was a French man by the name of Hippolyte Arnoux stationed at Port Said Light House in the Suez Canal, supposedly roughly from 1869 to 1880, according to the Link below. digitallibrary.usc.edu/bmpix/controller/about.htm I pulled his name from another link I do not have at the moment, however it can easily be found with a search for Arnoux Port Said. It also mentioned it is part of the Basel Mission which I know nothing about the "Basel Mission" digitallibrary.usc.edu/bmpix/controller/about.htm Historical Photographs from the Basel Mission "Journey to China and India." Cheers, Bobby Ronayne
